title: HIPAA Breach Incident
summary: A patient chart was accidentally emailed externally. Own the error openly; notify per protocol and reinforce compliance culture.

scene.setting: A patient chart was accidentally emailed externally. The patient complains. You feel legal anxiety; the hidden risk is regulatory fines. The decision point is cover up vs notify per protocol.

beats.narration: The breach is known. The decision point is minimize exposure or report transparently.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: We're notifying the patient and reporting per our HIPAA breach protocol. I own this as leadership.

choices.label: Apologize to the patient but avoid formal reporting to minimize exposure.

steps.step: Correct course: notify patient and report per policy; document and remediate.

leader_lines: We're doing the right thing now: notify and report.
questions: How do we train on reporting?
scripts.closing_line: Notify patient and OCR per policy; document and remediate.

choices.label: Notify the patient and report per HIPAA breach protocol; own it with the team.

steps.step: Notify patient and report per protocol; take responsibility in communication.
One reinforcement: breach drill, policy review, or PHI checklist.

leader_lines: I own this. We're notifying and reporting per policy.
questions: How do we reinforce compliance culture?
What role-based training do we need?
scripts.closing_line: Document and remediate; train team on reporting.

choices.label: Fix the process quietly and only tell the patient if they ask.

steps.step: Notify per HIPAA breach rule and policy; document steps taken.

leader_lines: Minimizing isn't complying. We're notifying as soon as we know.
questions: What do we put in writing?
scripts.closing_line: Notify in writing with steps taken.

choices.label: Blame the staff member who sent the email and discipline them.

steps.step: Take responsibility in communication; review process and person.
Improve systems and training; notify per protocol.

leader_lines: I own this as leadership. We're fixing process and systems.
questions: How do we review process, not just person?
scripts.closing_line: Own the error; improve systems; notify per policy.

system_prompts.nudge: Transparency in crisis builds long-term trust.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you own the error or shift blame?

outcomes.message: Cover-up or blame may have compounded the breach. Trust and compliance at risk.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with transparent reporting?
How do you own the error as leadership?

outcomes.message: Accountability is clear. Compliance culture strengthened; team knows the standard.
reflection_questions: How do you prevent fear from blocking reporting?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week we owned an error and reinforced compliance. (1-5)
